metadata.title: CVE-2021-29970 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A malicious webpage could have triggered a use-after-free, memory corruption, and a potentially exploitable crash. *This bug could only be triggered when accessibility was enabled.*. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 78.12, Firefox ESR < 78.12, and Firefox < 90.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-29970` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 90.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '90.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
mozjs78 package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.12.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
